## Last Verse
<!--Put a short poem you created using chatGPT of 20 to 30 lines,here!-->
In a world so vast, where creatures crawl,  
There resides a humble creature, oh so small.  
With a shell upon its back, a spiral of grace,  
The snail emerges in its gentle pace.  
  
A wanderer of nature, in search of delight,  
It ventures through gardens, both day and night.  
With patience unmatched, it explores its terrain,  
Leaving trails behind, a shimmering silver chain.  
  
Through dew-kissed blades of grass, it leaves its mark,  
A testament to perseverance, even in the dark.  
With a curious eye, it peers at the world,  
Slowly moving forward, its destiny unfurled.  
  
With every inch it travels, it teaches us still,  
To savor life's moments, at our own tranquil will.  
For in the snail's journey, we find a gentle grace,   
A reminder to slow down, and find our own pace.  
  
Though others rush past, in their hurried flight,  
The snail reminds us to savor the quiet night.  
To embrace the slowness, to cherish each turn,  
For within its humble shell, life's lessons we discern.  
  
So let us honor the snail, with its humble trail,  
And learn from its wisdom, without fail.  
In its patient steps, we find solace anew,  
A reminder to embrace life's gentle hue.  
  
Oh, lovely snail, in your humble attire,  
You inspire us to pause, to admire.  
Through your simple existence, a story unfolds,  
Of beauty in stillness, as nature beholds.
